question: (1) In Saudi Arabia, the notes currency has the kalima "La ilaha illallahu muhammadur rasoolallah" apears on the currency.
answer:
QUESTION
Is it a sin to print these most important words of islam on such currencies, whats your opinion/view on these issue? (2) After Friday Jumah prayer's azaan, is there any sunnat salaats to be prayed before and after the Jummah salaat? People used to offer 4 rakats sunnat before and immediately after Jumah salaat, 4 rakats sunnat then 2 rakats sunnat then 2 rakat nafil. What my question is 4 rakats sunnat salaat is to be prayed before and after Jumah salaat?? (3) How our beloved nabi sallallahu alaihi wassallam prayed his Friday Jumah salaat? (4) Please explain in detail step by step for performing fard & witr salats for both men and women (from Takbeer till tashahhud i.e. where to place his/her hands in takbeer below/above the belly button, whether to raise his/her hands up and say allahuakbar while going for ruku, what all limbs should touch the floor, etc. etc) as per our beloved Rasul's (sallallahu alaihiwassallam) salaat. (5) While reading or asking duas the body is shaking/swings for better concentration, this movement of shaking is allowed while reading or while asking duas or it is a makrooh? (6) In my dream - Catching fishes in varieties and in different beautiful shapes in small, medium and big sizes and storing them all together in a tank but dont know for what purpose I m catching and stories those fishes. what does this dream meant for?. Waiting to hear from you for the above questions.

1. It has been stated in Fataawaa Aalamgeeriyyah that there is no harm in printing the blessed name of Allah on dirhams and gold coins. The reason stated is that this is done in order to recognize a Muslim currency and not to disgrace or humiliate the name of Allah. The same ruling will apply for the Saudi Arabian currency.
